name: InstallExtension
description: Install a published extension to an Azure DevOps organisation or Team Foundation Server
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: connectedServiceName
inputs.label: Visual Studio Marketplace
inputs.helpMarkDown: Service endpoint connection to install the extension.

inputs.name: connectedServiceNameTFS
inputs.label: TFS Local Gallery connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Service endpoint connection to install the extension.

inputs.name: method
inputs.label: Install using
inputs.helpMarkDown: Install using either an existing VSIX or using the Publisher and Extension ID.

inputs.name: publisherId
inputs.label: Publisher ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Publisher ID of the extension to be installed.

inputs.name: extensionId
inputs.label: Extension ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Extension ID of the extension to be installed

inputs.name: extensionTag
inputs.label: Extension Tag
inputs.helpMarkDown: Extension Tag to append to the extension ID

inputs.name: vsixFile
inputs.label: VSIX file
inputs.helpMarkDown: VSIX file of the extension to be installed. Supports wildcards.

inputs.name: accounts
inputs.label: Install in
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma separated list of organisations where to install the extension (e.g. org_x,org_y,org_z) Or fully qualified TFS Collection URL (e.g. `https://yourserver/tfs/DefaultCollection`).

inputs.name: arguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional arguments passed to the package and publishing tool.

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Working directory to run the package and publishing process from. Defaults to the folder where the manifest is located.
